intro: Teclea villosa, commonly known as the hairy teclea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Teclea villosa is often found in shrublands and forest edges, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
